title: BMU holds seminar on present, future of clinical pharmacology
body: Bangladesh Medical University held a seminar titled Present and Future of Clinical Pharmacology in Education, Research and Patient Care at the BMU’s Shaheed Dr Milton Hall in Dhaka on Thursday. BMU vice-chancellor Professor Dr Md Shahinul Alam was present as chief guest at the seminar, said a press release. BMU pro-VC, research and development, Professor Dr Md Mujibur Rahman Hawlader and treasurer Professor Dr Nahrin Akhtar were present as special guests at the seminar. BMU pro-VC, administration, Professor Dr Md Abul Kalam Azad, Dhaka University clinical pharmacy and pharmacology department’s chairperson Professor Sheikh Zahir Raihan, Holy Family Red Crescent Medical College pharmacology department’s head Professor Dr Morshed Nasir and BMU pharmacology department acting chairperson Dr Elora Sharmin were present as discussants at the seminar.
